Kirkwood gaps are observed in the main asteroid belt including at the position(s) where: A. asteroids would orbit with a period half that of Jupiter, B. asteroids would orbit with a period twice that of Jupiter, C. asteroids would orbit with a period twice that of Mars, D. A and B

The correct answer: D. A and B.

Kirkwood gaps are regions in the main asteroid belt where fewer asteroids are found due to gravitational interactions with Jupiter. These gaps occur at orbital resonances with Jupiter, including where asteroids would orbit with a period half that of Jupiter (1:2 resonance) and where they would orbit with a period twice that of Jupiter (2:1 resonance).
